intro: Mendoncia cowanii var. coursii, commonly known as the Coursier's mendoncia, is a rare and striking plant native to specific regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and fibrous root system. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, daisy-like flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a valuable subject for botanical research and conservation efforts.
